attributes.action: Ban marriages and sexual relationships between first degree relatives.
attributes.additional_details:
See these article
Bradford study finds higher birth defect risk in married cousins
 https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-leeds-23183102

People should know the risks of marrying their cousin
https://www.bbc.co.uk/bbcthree/article/6af25e7b-0545-42ba-a6fa-82ac1023b4ed
attributes.background: Marrying a first degree relative increases the risk of genetic abnormalities. These relationships need to be banned to reduce the number of future children with such conditions.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action. 

A first degree relative is usually considered to be a person's parent, sibling, or child. Marriages between these types of relatives are already prohibited. We're therefore not sure what further action you'd like the UK Government and Parliament to take. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
